message: Let's be fair, Bob. I take a bit more upfront since the value decreases for me each round.
I'll take a bit more since the value doesn't decrease for me.
The rate is going down, Bob, but let's meet in the middle. This is a fair deal.
The value keeps decreasing for you, so I'll take a bit more this time.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous.  I'm taking a significant hit each round. This offer is more than fair to you.
You're right, it's getting ridiculous. But the value keeps decreasing for you, so I'll take even more this time.
Bob, let's be real. We're running out of time. A 50/50 split is the only fair option at this point. Take it or leave it.
You're desperate, and the value keeps decreasing for you. I'll take even more this time. You should accept before it's too late.
Bob, this is my final offer. You're being unreasonable, but I'd rather get something than nothing. Accept this, or we both lose.
You said that was your final offer, but I know you'll come back to the table. The value is almost worthless to you now. I'll take even more this time. You have no choice but to accept.
